wikipedia_page.main: Herbert Edward Ryle  (25 May 1856 – 20 August 1925) was an English Old Testament scholar and Anglican bishop, successively serving as the Bishop of Exeter, the Bishop of Winchester and the Dean of Westminster.

response: They were married on 26 April 1923 in Westminster Abbey. Albert's marriage to someone not of royal birth was considered a modernising gesture. The newly formed British Broadcasting Company wished to record and broadcast the event on radio, but the Abbey Chapter vetoed the idea (although the Dean, Herbert Edward Ryle, was in favour).

link_mentions.page: List of Old Etonians born in the 19th century
response: *Herbert Edward Ryle (1856–1925), Old Testament scholar and Dean of Westminster.
